description.plain:
Alexandre Morand, better known by his stage name Smiley (also known as Mr. B.O.B), is a rapper hailing from Toronto’s Pelham Park neighbourhood.

Behind the scenes, Smiley is a prominent figure in Toronto’s criminal underworld, however, since turning his talents to music, Smiley has cemented his position as one of the most exciting artists emerging from Toronto.

Fusing a lackadaisical flow and torpid cadence with gritty and descriptive lyrics, Smiley narrates the trials and tribulations he’s experienced growing up on the streets of Toronto. His trademark voice and storytelling ability have helped Smiley secure a fervent fanbase and receive support from industry staples and fellow musicians alike.

Smiley signed with Drake’s OVO Sound record label in 2021, and in July of that year the duo dropped “Over the Top,” catapulting Smiley to international stardom.

Fusing a lackadaisical flow and torpid cadence with gritty and descriptive lyrics, Smiley narrates the trials and tribulations he’s experienced growing up on the streets of Toronto. His trademark voice and storytelling ability have helped Smiley secure a fervent fanbase and receive support from industry staples and fellow musicians alike.

Smiley signed with Drake’s OVO Sound record label in 2021, and in July of that year the duo dropped “Over the Top,” catapulting Smiley to international stardom.

songs.full_title: Over the Top by Smiley (Ft. Drake)
songs.title: Over the Top

description.plain:
On “Over the Top,” Smiley enlists OVO head-honcho Drake for their first officially released collaboration.

The upbeat track, produced by Drake’s frequent collaborator Tay Keith, arrives via Drake’s OVO Sound record label, which Smiley signed to in 2021.

The song was a commercial hit, reaching #57 on the Billboard Hot 100, marking Smiley’s first entry on the chart.

Yeah, yeah

I gotta chase me a bag
My shooters think it's tag (Brrrah)
She wanna buy me a Jag'
BM text me, throw ten at her like Messi (Here you go, babe)
Take the Draco, please make it messy (Yeah)
Told Kilani I want grills like Nelly's (Uh-huh)
I was locked, no one answered their cellys (No one)
No change in my line, used my celly's
This TEC-9 hold many
Lucky told me don't trust many, gang

Don't grip on my hand
I know that I came with a slide from left to right, but now I don't wanna dance

Nike don't pay me to tell you, "Just do it"
They pay me to show you I'll do it again

[Post-Chorus: Smiley]
Huh? Yeah

songs.title: Organization

description.plain:
On “Organization,” Smiley teams up with his fellow Toronto artists Drake and Booggz.

Drake used lyrics from the song in a caption for an Instagram post on October 23, 2019. A week later, Murda Beatz teased the track via Twitter. The song eventually leaked on December 14, 2019.

The song was unofficially released on March 4, 2020, and subsequently removed. It will most likely never have an official release.

songs.embed_content: Read “Organization” by Smiley on Genius

body.plain:

Drake used lyrics from the song in a caption for an Instagram post on October 23, 2019. A week later, Murda Beatz teased the track via Twitter. The song eventually leaked on December 14, 2019.

The song was unofficially released on March 4, 2020, and subsequently removed. It will most likely never have an official release.

songs.title: Intro

description.plain:
“Intro” is the first track off Smiley_61st’s A Tape To Remember. The song gained much of its notoriety from Drake who posted a video of himself rapping along to the song, amassing 11 million views in one week.



The track mentions his many struggles and hustles in life.
